holidays.name: National Clam Chowder Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the creamy, savory soup loved along the Atlantic Coast ‚Äî think New England-style clam chowder loaded with clams, potatoes, and cream.
holidays.origin: Originates from the traditional chowder recipes of the Northeastern United States, particularly New England, where clam chowder is a regional favorite.
holidays.funFact: Did you know New England clam chowder originally used salt pork as the base instead of cream? The creamy version became popular later!

holidays.name: Digital Learning Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and promote the use of digital technology in education, highlighting innovative learning tools and digital classrooms worldwide.
holidays.origin: Launched by the All4Ed organization in 2012 to raise awareness about the importance of technology in advancing education.
holidays.funFact: Schools often host virtual reality lessons on this day, allowing students to 'travel' the world without leaving their desks!

holidays.name: Tell a Fairy Tale Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day encouraging everyone to share, read, or create fairy tales, sparking imagination and storytelling magic among all ages.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the tradition of oral storytelling, this day honors fairy tales‚Äô role in culture and education.
holidays.funFact: Fairy tales have been retold for centuries, and some versions date back over 1,000 years!

holidays.name: Chocolate Covered Nut Day

holidays.origin: Informal holiday created by fans of chocolate and nuts enjoying this classic treat on this date.
